They finally picked up after more than 5 minutes on hold and telling you it's easier to order online! arg!! Then, I got like a 100 questions while placing the order! Spell your first and last name. Soy you want a beverage? Do you want ice cream with your dessert? OMG I'm practically there by now! Then she asks me what is the make and model of my car. Twice. Finding the so called car pickup spot was another five minutes. She never mentioned where that was located. These places think they are so convenient but they have people answer the phone who have no consideration for the customer or no clue. Of course the food had not arrived at my car in the promised time. Took way longer. What a shock! I am still waiting for the order. I only hope the food is worth the hassles.

Usually I don't eat pizza but decided to try CPK. Pizza and salad is not my thing. Decided to try something different and I regret it. Pizza is pizza no matter how you cook it. The only thing that makes it different is the price. CPK is to expensive for just pizza! Next time I'm in the urge for pizza I'm going for little Cesar's..

Delicious pizza and fast service.  I was here about 4 years ago haha so I have a long overdue review.  We sat outside to eat, me and my parents.  I will be back.  Hopefully someday soon since I live nearby.

I came with to this Cpk for my fiend's birthday on a Friday night. The environment is nice, a little different than other Cpk's I've been been to. We had reservations so we were seated upon our arrival. We were a group of 7 and everyone seemed to enjoy their order. I got the Tri-color pizza with chicken. It's huge for one person so it's definitely shareable. It's a delicious option not found on the menu. Most of the plates they have are good, but I just feel like they don't have much option, hence the 4 stars. Overall, good service, good food, but a lack of options.

After more than 15 years in Pasadena, I finally went to CPK.  I was given a really friendly greeting by the guy at the door and while waiting for a friend, the chef came over with a complimentary flatbread appetizer as a welcome.  Wow, how nice.  My food was really tasty and the service was excellent.  Right before leaving, i was given a cookie and coupon for my next visit.  Seriuosly, how many restaurants give people the first class treatment?  You guys rock!

CPK never ceases to disappoint. I had their halibut, bbq chicken pizza, and kale salad....all were just simply devine. So tasty and filling. Portion sizes are proportional the prices. There's garage parking just underground. We went during off hours so servers were pretty attentive. It's a pretty big place and I can imagine it getting very busy so not sure how service would be then, but for the most part they seem to enjoy their work. Will definitely be returning.

Has been at least six years since I was here. The place has been remodeled and looks good. The lights were dim, making it a little hard to see as I was reviewing some paperwork with a client. JB was excellent and explained the menus. The manager brought us a complimentary appetizer thinking it was our first time there. My salad was great but the portion seemed smaller than I remembered. It was still enough and I left happy.

My girlfriend and I usually come here when we are craving the tequila fettuccine pasta.  Parking is underground. Make sure to validate your ticket upon arrival in case you forget when you leave.  Service is great and very accommodating. Make sure to ask for bread while you wait for you meal to ease your hunger. Crayons and color books available for kids.

This place is fantastic for catering as well. My order is perfect every time and I always appreciate their effort. I usually pick up my orders and they have always been prepared on time. I serve many meals throughout Pasadena and CPK is my go to restaurant. My customers love their food and are always stoked to see what I'm bringing. Thanks CPK for making me look good!

I am giving this place a two and a half for food. The food was tasty and usual CPK Style however the pizza was little extra oily and the tortilla soup tasted like it was out of a can. But nothing worth demeaning or putting the food down. Our real issue was with the service and the non-existent waitress the restaurant was half empty as it was the end of lunch time or just past lunchtime and it was a mission to get ahold of her or to even see her at times. Also when it finaly came time to pay our bill she took off with my credit card and held it or did something with it for about 15 minutes. Understand if a place is busy it takes a while but you don't take off with someones card and hold onto it for that long. We were just so neglected and extra ignored today not the kind of service we like.

I just want to say Thank You to everyone who works at this location specially managed by someone with such a big heart Alex greeted my daughter and her friends who had just finished volunteering all day for the eggbowl which is an event held at the rose bowl for Easter for the children to partake in,  anyways he was real friendly and generous and payed for all their meals. Acts like this restore my faith in humanity.

I am extremely impressed with this place, my mother has always been a fan and I myself had not been to a California Pizza Kitchen in years. We had a family night and were seated immediately no reservation. They took our order and food came in a great pace, I did not feel they were taking long nor did any of my family but a manager came to the table to explain their "delay" and only 2 or 3 minutes later received the food. Everything was kind and warm welcoming. Extremely enjoyable, food was delicious and staff was amazing. Would recommend and cant wait to come back.

I had a couple of friends who lived really close to this CPK so we would come here occasionally. Apparently they have validated underground parking but we would just walk over (they lived that close by!). The location is quite large so we never had to wait more than a few minutes and the staff here has always been great. Our servers are always nice and friendly and would check up on us every now and then. I really liked our spacious their interior is. They also have a nice bar area in the middle. If I recall correctly the bathrooms were pretty nice too. This is definitely a more upscale CPK than the one at my mall :P The food is pretty good here. I have gotten salads and pizzas and everything has been fine. But ever since CPK discontinued my favourite pizza I rarely find myself going to their restaurants... But if I did go, this location is a good one! I haven't gone back in a while though since my friends moved away...

It's our first time to eat at California Pizza. Me and my husband enjoyed the Jamaican Chicken Pizza and fresh lemonade strawberry plus they gave us a nice pizza bread which is on the house. The staff were very accommodating and friendly.

Poorly Managed and Serves Raw Chicken. I visit a CPK at least once per week, usually the Downtown Los Angeles location or the Arcadia location. Those locations are run tight as a ship. Excellent customer service. Reliable food service. Walked in to this location and no one was up front to greet us or seat us. After 4 minutes, a host walked by but said he would come back. Apparently, he had to get bread plates and settings for another table he had seated. A second host came by and she seemed lost. By the way, this restaurant was only 10 percent occupied at 11:45 am on a Saturday. We finally got seated and had a good waitress, which is why THIS LOCATION got two stars. Ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken while my wife ordered the seasonal salad. The grapes were old and brown in the salad. Hello Kitchen. Just DO NOT serve them. Leave the old grapes out of the dish. The chicken was RAW on the inside for my Kung Pao Spaghetti.  Apparently, someone in the kitchen was still drunk from the night before or improperly trained. Food Illness could SINK the CPK brand. Big NO NO. The manager should be fired, or at a minimum demoted.

We had the worst experience on Friday 4/22..We just wanted to eat dinner however our server didn't think we deserved to eat at this location.. After waiting for more than 15 minutes for her we decided  to leave but not before speaking to the manager. We told her the waitress did not even acknowledge us at all after we were seated. However she acknowledged all the new people being seated..And to top it off as we were speaking to the manager they sat someone  at our table and the waitress  acknowledged them right away. She must be a Trump supporter...It's a shame that people like that still exist. We will never return to this location...

Ugh. So I ordered delivery here from grub hub and not only was my order completely messed up, but my pizza was partially burnt, and cold. They delivered us the pizza we ordered, and the pasta we ordered, but didn't pay attention to any of the details we requested. (My husband has allergies to certain foods) I called grub hub to complain, and they called me back telling me that the restaurant was sure my order was correct and insisted that the driver messed it up. Really? The driver put ingredients on our pizza that we specifically asked not to have and forgot our dressing? Thanks, but no thanks. I won't be ordering here again.

Great place to eat! Customer service is good and the food is exceptional. They have a lot of choices and have good drinks, too.  Meal can get pricey though so make sure you're willing to pay $10 - $15 per person, and that's not including drinks. Personally, I think that the food is worth the price :)

I used to love CPK many moons ago and I went back recently and got an old favorite -- Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp.  I always order this "no garlic" as I despise garlic.  I don't want to see it, breath it or taste it, yuck!  I picked up this order curbside which is really convenient, no complaints on the lady who brought out my order.  Ten minutes later and I was sitting at my desk in the office ready to enjoy my lunch and lo and behold, I see a TON of garlic in my food.  What part of 'no garlic' do they not understand?  This was no accident.  I decided to suck it up and eat it anyway but after two bites and on the verge of throwing up, I gave up.  I was really angry for spending $20 on lunch and I can't even eat it.  I spoke to the manager of this branch and he graciously told me he will have someone deliver me a new one with no garlic. That's great, that's really the least they could do.  I was satisfied BUT he offered no apology and hung up on me when I said thank you.  The experience and the food left a really bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively.  I will not be returning.

I know I know..it's a chain restaurant but this place is pretty good.   Tips: parking is underground on union . They validate your parking.   ribeye : decent for cpk. I ordered medium rare but it came out more on the medium side. Herb butter and it was ok Sicilian pizza : lots of flavor and delicious  Waldorf salad : my go to salad but I forgot to say no celery  Red velvet with ice cream : weird combo? Nah it's amazing and not too sweet. It also had some vanilla bean cream under it. So good  Service : server checked in us pretty often but I could tell he was overwhelmed with the two big tables he has
Thank you for honoring the Veterans ,i am a us army Veteran from the 185 medical in Stanton  and cpk staff will treat you very special once you show ur ID . Thanks again  Dr D

We stayed at a hotel near here so we decided to walk and get dinner at CPK, having never been to one. The wait for a table was about 20 min, which was right with what they'd warned. We were seated outside, which would have been great had there been more lighting. I enjoy a darker, outdoor dining experience but I do like enough light to read my menu. A real candle, an ample amount of string lighting, anything that wouldn't have made it necessary for my family to all use their phones as lights, would have been preferable. Not sure if the lighting was hidden and just not turned on, or if it was actually meant to be that dark, but when the food arrived, we could barely make out what we were eating. The place stayed busy, almost too busy for the servers they have. Once we were seated, it was about ten minutes before anyone asked us our drink order. To be honest, we were contemplating heading to the steakhouse next door. All in all, I'm glad we didn't. Once they took our drink order, the ball got rolling. Our server Jamie (I think that was her name-she was from NYC)-was awesome. Very friendly, and even though she was busy, she kept refills and everything going. There was also a male server that looked as though he was staying running; he had originally taken our drink order and also helped serve the food. Very friendly and upbeat. Another lady brought us napkins and silverware and for a first time visit, a free appetizer! Some kind of cheesy flatbread that my husband and kids thoroughly enjoyed, if the fact that they wolfed it down says anything. I was concentrating on the avocado club egg rolls we had ordered. If you like bacon, these are for you! Very tasty, with just enough tomatoes and avocado and the dipping sauces go well with them. Let's see, around the table reviews, my husband liked the ribeye a lot but wished there was a mashed potato option (were southern) :). But it was cooked medium, just the way he liked it. My oldest enjoyed his garlic chicken and veggies and the avocado ranch sauce & my youngest liked his pepperoni pizza, although he didn't care for the amount of basil. There is quite a bit. I got a works pizza and it was good, it could have used a little more sauce and cheese, but there were ample veggies and the meats were huge. Overall, we would go back. It had an above average chain food taste (reminded me of Cheesecake Factory somewhat), but the people made it a great experience. Thanks, Pasadena CPK!

This CPK has good food however the cleanliness is lacking.  It's not too busy to have clean floors.  Literally around me are 7 empty tables with trash scattered all around. Probably won't be visiting again anytime soon.  I can't imagine what the kitchen looks like!

This is the best CPK I've been to. The service is awesome from the moment you are welcomed in to the restaurant, the host opens the door for you with a smile. The servers are super nice and attentive. The food is outstanding!!! 5 stars is well-deserved. JB our server is amazing!

Yesterday a friend treated my daughter and I for lunch here at California Pizza Kitchen and it was my first time being there! As many times as I've passed this restaurant and told myself I need to try it some time, I've never eaten there. Glad I did.  The food was great, the staff was so friendly, and I can't wait to come again (only to this location since they made my first visit the best) to try their other dishes.  Another upside to this location besides the amazing staff is the outdoor seating with a nice ambience of flowers and a fountain. I'm not sure if other locations have outdoor seating (I have only passed by the location at the Santa Anita Mall and didn't notice or pay attention), but it was perfect to enjoy the sunny afternoon!  I feel bad that I don't remember all of their names because everyone was just incredible! Jackie was our server!  Appetizers:  The Bianco  The Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings  Guacamole Corn Dip & Chips Pizza:  Thai Chicken Pizza

For whatever reason, this place has very slow service and the kitchen is very slow. Since it's a chain, the food is good and tastes like every other CPK that you've ever been too. I appreciate the two different sizes for wine, but at $16 for a nine oz of red, that's kind of pricey. Last time I tried the Moroccan chicken salad which was light and very tasty. Ended with a chocolate cake which was good, but slightly overpriced and definitely needs to be shared.

When you go to CPK, you basically know what to expect in terms of food. I gave CPK five stars and deservedly so for its service. My son has autism. Whenever we go to this CPK, everyone goes out of their way to accommodate us. In December,  there was a wonderful blonde greeter who not only went out of her way to give my son the absolute best service, but also spent a few minutes playing with my son outside in the patio as well. I am sorry that I do not know her name. The food is good, but the caring atmosphere is great!

Came in and was seated right away. They were definitely understaffed as it took 10 minutes to ask for our drinks and another 15 minutes for them to come, even water. We got appetizers about 20 minutes after ordering and by the time our main course arrived, we were all full from the appetizers and waiting for so long. Food was ok, not the best. The wait time was definitely a bummer and flagging our waiter or any waiter/waitress down was difficult. Service today could have been a fluke due to being understaffed but they really weren't all that busy.
I've been here several times, and every time the food is just ok. Service is usually good, decor and seating is fine, but it's overpriced average food.
Fantastic costumer service from every single staff member from the moment we walked in the door. And the pizza is excellent as well :)

CPK, ummmm. . .  it is a chain and it is pretty obvious. This location has both valet for $8 and underground garage parking which is free for the first 90 minutes with validation.  The service was great. The serves were on top of their things and made the experience pleasant. The food is a -ok which is why I gave it a 3-star review. I feel like there is just nothing special about it, nothing that really calls to me that is. For instance, the cheesy Alfredo is just cheesy not lush or flavorful.  They do have a good drink selection which is nice but not the main point of going to a restaurant in my option. Good thing to note, it is fairly easy to have big group parties here if you're looking for a spot to host something of the sorts. For instance, my cousin had her 30th birthday party here which consisted of 30 or so people. We got the option of soft drinks, a salad, a pasta, and shared pizza around the table for $20 a person.

I never write reviews but this CPK location was on point. The pesto penne with grilled shrimp and the BBQ chicken salad is amazing!! Also, our waitress Milo was on top of everything and constantly made sure we were taken care of. No doubt she will take care of you! Our meal was delayed and she spoke to the manager to compensate for the wait.. Amazing!!! Great food and service!(:

CPK is a safe place to order food, if you're not feeling adventurous or want to risk getting something you haven't tried before. The oil and herbs that come with the complementary bread is delicious. I normally order the pesto penne pasta with shrimp and sun dried tomatoes. But if you're really wanting something decadent get the butter cake. OMG this cake will change your life. Order it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and ask for strawberries on the side. Make sure the strawberries aren't covered in syrup, you want fresh strawberries to get the experience of the magnificent dessert. Good luck!

Disappointing!  It was nice to have curb side pick-up.  Easy!  However, pizza was super disappointing.  We ordered BBQ chicken pizza.  VERY few toppings.  Lots of crust with not toppings.  Blah.  Tasted like it could have been a frozen pizza.  The only reason why it earned 2 stars is because of the ease of the curb side pick-up.

I love CPK and the food but this place lacks service. Our food always comes late and the server was given so many tables that she often forgot about us and forgot to bring drinks and refills etc. The only reason why I'm giving it two stars instead of one is because of the nice location and free underground parking. But other than that, the restrooms were dirty with only one stall working and our food didn't come until about 45 min to an hour later. Also when the food came out our pastas were completely cold so we had to send it back and when we did send it back they forgot again and we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. The most frustrating thing for us was that we had a 5 year old toddler and he was crying because he was starving.

Excellent food like usual at this CPK. Margarita pizza delicious. Good drinks too. Salads are very good. House bread is sourdough and the olive oil mixture they serve with it is spot on. Steer clear of the bolognese pasta.

Hostess who greeted us didn't - had an attitude as soon as we walked inside and was not cordial at all.  The place was fairly empty, so I'm not sure what the issue was.  Our waiter, Freddy, was very personable and attentive and because of him I'm leaving a comment.  Pizza arrived cold, manager delivered food to gluten free recipient reaching directly over someone (while they were eating) without even as much as apologizing for the intrusion. No pleasantries from the manager either, we could tell serving was probably not her forte.  We were just glad to enjoy each other, graciously tip our waiter and then leave. There are so many other CPK's around where one can receive a much more pleasant vibe - why bother with this one? Will not be returning here.

I convinced my parents to take us here last night because we had always come here when I was little and I remember it being my favorite restaurant. However, we left very disappointed that we had spent our money on such trashy, overpriced food. First of all, we weren't seated in the main dining area, even though there were so many empty tables. Instead, we were seated in the uglier part/ back of the restaurant next to other groups of Asians. Coincidence? I hope so, but this isn't the first time I've noticed this happening.  I ordered based on what I used to love, the spinach artichoke dip, and the Thai Chicken Pizza. Horrible, just horrible. The spinach artichoke dip came with really stale tortilla chips, and the dip itself wascold and seemed like it had been sitting in the microwave for some time. We asked our server for new chips, and he brought new ones for us which were less stale, but instead of replacing the stale chips with the new ones, he left the stale ones and brought the new ones on another plate. Why would we even eat the stale ones?? For the Thai chicken pizza was so bad for something that I remember being so good. The Brussel sprouts were raw and soggy all at the same time. The carrots tasted uncooked and it was just basically a raw salad on top of the pizza. There didn't even seem to be any cheese on it. We also ordered the mushroom pizza, which sounded amazing, and asked for the truffle oil for another $1.50. No truffle oil was on the pizza when we got it, so I complained and our waiter gave us some on the side. The chicken piccata pasta was extremely sour and lemony, and overall, everything else we ordered was disappointing and not even worth mentioning in this review.  All in all, a very disappointing experience and definitely not worth the $150 we spent here. Don't recommend this place at all. Hopefully other branches might be better.

CPK used to be a dependable place - tasty food with decently sized portions and only moderately inflated prices. Now, however, the food is mediocre due to skimping on the key ingredients (aka, the ones highlighted in the menu) and with the portions drastically smaller the prices are effectively skyrocketing. With so many lunch options within walking distance, it's time to move on.

The slowest service ever. We waited 10 minutes for our waiter after sitting down, another couple walked in 5 minutes after us and got served before us, and we waited forever for our food and drinks. And the place was half empty.

My boyfriend and I went to go eat at CPK the other night and our server Grace made our experience amazing! She was so attentive and extremely nice. She recommended the BeHive Sangria for me and it was so good. Decently coming back to this location.

Haven't been to CPK in a while and the last few times it didn't seem all that, but tonight was different. Our server JB was very accommodating and had a great attitude. He was on top of his service and knew what he was talking about. CPK has definitely updated their concept, but in a good way. Will be coming back again more often than every so often.

This is a beautiful location. We usually love the food at CPK. However ,this sever wasn't having a good day at work and it effected our dinning experience.We had to ask for extra napkins, a spoon for the salad, and fresh black pepper.   I feel bad that she was not in her best spirits,but when you are in a  customer service, you still smile and make sure that your customers are having a good experience.

I made the mistake of assuming CPK's revamped menu and modernized interior would translate to delicious food. Boy was I wrong. Well, at least I used a gift card! -Baked Potato Soup: Tasted as bad as it sounds (although my boyfriend thought it sounded appetizing). The soup was extremely thick, overly creamy, and had a strong cheese flavor. -Farmers Market Soup: The squash flavor of this soup was more appealing, but the layer of oil on top was not. Also, I found it to be more sweet than savory. -Roasted Veggie Salad: The vegetables had a good roast on them and the salad was perfectly dressed. Sadly, this was probably my favorite dish of the night. -Sicilian Thin Crust Pizza: The pizza was dry and needed more sauce while the cheese had an odd spongey consistency. The crust wasn't crispy enough. I could have built a much tastier pizza at Blaze for half the price! -Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler: This drink tasted rather diet-y, as if artificial sweetener was used instead of the "natural flavors of mango, guava, and ginger" as described on the menu. Should have gone for the flavored lemonade! Tip to the business: Instead of updating your look, you need to update your recipes! I hadn't been to CPK in several years and I won't be returning for several more based on this disappointing experience.

I usually don't go to this location but since the one in the mall was closed, decided to come here. We got seated quickly enough, but the server took such a long time to come by our table that we were all ready to order. Our food came out in a timely manner and looked pretty good. When the bill came, I was a little disappointed. I had ordered two kids meals, which are each supposed to come with a drink. However, I was charged for one of the kid's drinks. I didn't want to make a big deal so I didn't say anything about it, which was my mistake. But when my change came back, the server only gave me back my change in bills, omitting my coins. No explanation. Nothing. Those coins and the charge for the kid's drink added up to about $2 now. Not that big a deal, but just the principle. Maybe because I didn't say anything about the drink charge the sethought they could gyp me on my coins now too? I don't know.  Big disappointment at this location so I won't be back again. The one in the mall has much better service.

A terrible experience tonight. Normally a restaurant that provides good food and service.  A mistake occurred with our meal.  Our waitress acknowledged the mistake and apologized. The manager, Caroline, offered no apology and did not follow up at any point during the meal. We had to ask to speak to her after the meal.  We complained and before we knew it we were escorted out of the restaurant.  Amazing. No reason provided. Caroline hiding in the back office. She refused to speak. But she did ask us never to come back.  Curiously she did not want us to pay either. So there is apparently no record of us being there. Except for the video showing us being escorted out.  Taking my pizza dough elsewhere.

Had a horrible experience today at the CPK Pasadena. All courses ordered --soup, salads, pastas & pizza-- arrived at the same time. The entrees were getting cold while we ate our soup & salads. We complained. The waiter was apologetic. Despite Caroline, the manager, acknowledging the mistake, she was offended at the frustration & annoyance expressed. Rather than apologizing, she asked us to leave & told us never to come back. (Surprisingly, she also comped the entire meal for our party of 6.) She left our table without providing an explanation & refused to come out from her office when we asked to see her to discuss. Next thing, security was at our table to escort us out of the restaurant. This is unbelievable! Unfortunately, no appreciation for our 30+ years of patronage. Guess you can't complain at CPK. Many other pizza places in Pasadena to go to that  care about the customer's experience.
Hey management, treat ur staff with respect and stop yelling to them in front of customers especially the drivers!!!!

This was slightly worse than I expected from a chain, but not so terrible as to say it was a bad experience. We were seated at the end of the lunch rush, so that may have contributed to the incredibly slow service. After being seated for a moment, a male server came over to introduce himself and said he would be with us as soon as he gave the check to another table. He did this and then disappeared. Nearly 10 minutes later, a female server came over and introduced herself and said she would be with us after she took drinks to another table. After waiting almost 15 minutes, we were finally able to order. While the server acknowledged the slow service, I don't think she actually realized how long we had been waiting there. After that, the meal moved somewhat quickly enough, although there was an additional delay in getting our checks taken care of. The server was at least quick on refilling drinks, and the runner that brought our food brought it quickly.  As for the food itself, it was on par for CPK. I had the lunch combo of a California veggie pizza and the Farmer's Market soup. The soup was flavorful, although I could have done without the layer of oil that was added to the top of the soup. (This was not a separation issue - there was an actual layer of olive oil added on top of the soup in a swirl pattern.) Ironically, the bread appetizer that came with olive oil and herbs with red pepper flakes were really good. The pizza was good, not great, but good. Like I said, it was standard CPK chain food. My colleague seemed to really enjoy his food. All in all, it was a perfectly decent experience, minus the confusion in the beginning.

It's very nice when you can still find your favorite food at a place you haven't been for a while. This is the best place for Chinese chicken salad. Really!  We enjoyed the artichoke dip, chicken wrap and pizza.  All very good. Service was a little slow but it was a busy night, it was ok.

We arrived at 930pm on Saturday (they close at 11pm) however service was bad and really slow, to top it off they were not busy at all. Waitress walked by at least 4 times before taking our entree orders. Never were we offered any refills. Manager was focused on Television Basketball game rather than checking on tables or helping expo the food. Parties near us seemed unsatisfied as well. Pacing was horrible, food came out different times. My dish came out  a solid 5 minutes after my gfs. Our waitress seemed like she wanted to end her shift already, at some point she disappeared. I would not recommend this location. Validated parking was nice though. For the service, food quality, and price.. i'd rather go to cheesecake factory.

Absolutely love this place! I've been to multiple CPK's but this one has to be my favorite. Location is great and they have 90 minute parking validation. My sister and I split a fettuccine with garlic cream sauce (added chicken and shrimp) and it was delicious! Out server, JB was very attentive and brought out our appetizer and drinks in a timely manner. I would definitely recommend this location and especially their amazing spinach artichoke dip! Thank you for our great lunch!

Customer service is excellent.  I found a hair in my food and the manager comped my meal. The server was still just as polite as she was when she took our order.  There were no questions asked and it was an immediate decision on their end.

The first experience I had here was amazing, but the last time I came in with a few of my coworkers was an absolute disaster. We had the same lovely server as we did the first time, so we know it was not her fault. My coworkers salad took a little longer than usual, and we noticed our server Jacky kept checking on it. when she asked her manager(the one with the beard. I think his name was Alex. He totally scolded the poor girl in front of everyone and paid for a few peoples food. It was not her fault the salads took a long time. We told her she did fabulous and to not listen to him, and the sad thing was she told us this isnt the first time he has done that. My coworkers and I talked about it after words, and there is no possible way we will be back. We cannot support a manager who treats his employees that way. SHAME ON HIM and shame on the company for being okay with that!!!!!!

Loyal customers for ten years. My girlfriend and I moved to Pasadena two years ago and since then this location has gotten half of our orders wrong. When we tried to contact management, they halfheartedly attempted to nullify their faults and treated us with very little patience. We know CPK as being a good business with stand-up employees; this location is disappointing.

-1 Star. Took too long to get our order. -1 Star. We had to ask for the complementary bread since it was never getting there. -1 Star. The food was a big disappointment! We have been at  others CPK and order what we ordered here and we knew how the food was supposed to taste. My pasta literally just tasted like pasta with lime, the other pasta we ordered they barely put food on the plate and both pastas barely had any chicken. We are definitely not coming back to this location. The only good things were the iced teas and appetizer, after that it went down the hill. :(
Wonderful service! The manager Gloria hustled to get our food out. She is a great manager and has a wonderful team. Food was great! Mac&cheese is the best.

I have been to this location multiple and the service has been consistent. Today my husband accidentally placed an incorrect order online. However the manager was kind enough to remake the order for us at no extra cost. I was impressed with their customer service. Will be back soon.
Always reliable service and if we're in a rush we just eat at the bar. Food satisfies everyone in the family, even our pickiest eater. So glad when CPK reverted back to serving crusty French bread.

This review is for service only. I called in my order and decided to use the curb side service for the first time. The person taking my order was short with me from the start of my phone call and overall lacked finesse when answering some of my questions. And to bluntly state, I would not have needed to ask these questions if she was more informative to begin with.  Given this is my first time ordering curb side, I asked questions such as  where  I should park (park in parking structure or on the street?) I feel this is a valid question given it is Pasadena and there may be parking in the front for pick ups.  She responded with a tone that was short and really made me feel like this was an obvious fact that I should know. And to make matters worse, her response was vague and lacked detail.  When ordering with her, she misheard my meal and was snappy when I corrected her. What happened to good ol customer service?  Or in this case, common courtesy. Someone working in this position  (especially on the phone ) should have good social skills and communication skills - both are lacking.  I made a large order that day and was thankful it was takeout...I would not have been  able to bare spending an evening with her as my server.  *Although my rating does not reflect the food - just want to share that food was tasty, came out hot and the overall takeout process is great. Came with all necessary utensils and plates as well - just make sure you give them the correct number of people dining so they give you the appropriate amount.

I've been going to this CPK for MANY years. This  used to be my favorite location.  Yesterday's visit will be my last. The new menu was lacking.  Why would most of the pizza choices be gone?! My favorite pizza the pear gongolza and tiramitsu are gone! I had the fish tacos which had an odd taste,  very little fish and taco shells were cold. Husband had chicken dish which had no flavor which consisted of chicken with lettuce on top. No taste= $18. One posive note was our server Traci she was sweet & very informative.  Very dissatisfied

Today 6/1/17 having a late lunch with my family and friends after my niece graduation. Service sucked the waitress i believe her name is kitty  along with the kitchen staff f'd up everyone's order in our party of 10. Food came out cold and the pizza was very cold and appeared that the kitchen staff nibbled off each pepperoni. I ordered a long island ice tea that was pure syrup. I can go on and on about today service around 3pm. Gloria the shift manager came and apologized that was probably the best experience at this place.  CPK get your sh** together. Thank you Gloria for your understanding and apology.

I always saw this place driving down towards the 110 fwy And i always kept it In mind I should try it out finally I got the chance too and it was a bad expirience. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza which consisted of onions bbq sauce and chicken pretty simple, when my pizza arrived to me it was so cold and only had 3 pieces of chicken and no onion i got In contact with the manager and he was so generous to send one again and it came back the same . Never coming back.

Sat at the bar and went all out for my daughter's bday and it went beyond my expectations!!! Why??? Because JB THE BARTENDER!!! He didn't blink when I did my usual add this but more of that and so on. He DELIVERED WITH A SMILE!!!  Been here many times but never had it at 200%.  CPK U LUCKED OUT HAVING THIS AWESOME EMPLOYEE

It was a great dining experience when I visited CPK.  We were warmly greeted once we entered and we were quickly asked if we parked underground and that they would take care of the validation so we could get that out of the way. The restaurant is bigger than it looks.  With the high ceilings and open floor plan, it's very bright and inviting inside.  There's also patio seating outside, and there's also an extra dining area to the right of the main area and that is where we were seated. Fred was our waiter and he was very on top of things.  He was refilling drinks once we were running low.  He brought us house bread which is still a classic after all these years.   I ordered the Thai chicken pizza.  It still tasted like how I remembered it.  I couldn't decide between that or the BBQ chicken pizza, both are great choices. CPK does have an app where you can earn points by how much you've spent, and I believe you can also pay for your bill through the app. Parking:  there's parking underground.  90 minutes free with validation.

Hosts and to go workers are apathetic and mostly rude. It's very uncomfortable picking up food from here. I made eye contact with the baby faced host in the front, smiled, said "thank you" loud and clear, and he just smirked and turned his head. You get a clear understanding that the employees hate their job here. Update: I just waited for 20 minutes on an order that this restaurant allegedly didn't receive. Once again, all employees were rude and unhelpful.  Update #2: I'm still catching major attitudes from to-go workers. The whole system needs to be rebuilt. I'm also forced to package the food in bags, I'm not even an employee of the company. I'm contracted by the customer to pick up their food. Does CPK not package food to all of their customers? Why is it that food isn't packaged for third party delivery orders? We provided a TON of business for this franchise, and they treat us like we're in a soup kitchen. I'm still waiting on a call from upper management. Final Update: I spoke with the General Manager, and he disregarded my complaints on his poorly run restaurant. Due to the fact that I'm an independent contractor, he refused to create a solution. For the record, I used to take my wife and children to eat here, and my family has eaten at CPK for decades; unbeknownst to this abominable manager. He's a big asshole and that's what I told him, point blank. Don't support this restaurant chain! Overpriced, careless, disgruntled, and negligent.
Jacky and Dj were awesome and very attentive they really shined! Had a great meal and it was easy to find vegan options:) any pizza is great with no cheese!

I wish that I could give less than one star for this location.  I eat at the downtown LA location almost everyday as it is next door to where I work so I know what the food should look and taste like, which is consistently good there. First of all the Pasadena location should quit advertising and taking "curbisde" orders.  There is no possibility of picking up your food curbside because they have allowed the restaurant next door to set up their valet service and park valeted cars in every single short term space.  There isn't a single space open to allow you to pick up your food.  So this is just false advertising and makes the whole experience very stressful when it is meant to make it easier.  Pasadena loves to give tickets and pass regulations so I am going to make sure to report the valet's practices, but that is another matter. I ordered the Chicken Milanese which is supposed to be warm panko crusted chicken.  There was no panko and the chicken was cold and dry.  I also ordered the mushroom pasta which was fine.  Finally I ordered the Strawberry Shortcake described as "piled high with seasonal strawberries, whipped cream and lemon zest".  When I got home and opened it up what I have is a soggy biscuit, eleven tiny slices of strawberry (maybe the equivalent of 2 1/2 whole) and no whipped cream or lemon zest at all. Although this location is less than 2 miles from my house, I will never be back.  It is worth a trip to Arcadia instead.

We had lunch here after many years. The manager served us an appetizer for visiting CPK, that was a nice treat "Buffalo Cauliflower with blue cheese. We ordered an appetizer and it arrived lady. I ordered tequila chicken fettuccine but wad undercooked, but enjoyed it. We had to ask for complimentary bread, other tables got it when seated...hmm.. the experience was average.. May not return to this place.

I last visited this CPK on 5/20/2016 around 9 pm. Around 20 minutes after we got there, this large SPIDER (about 1.5 inches across) dropped from metal bars on the east side of the building ONTO my boyfriend. We promptly killed it, but since we don't like spiders, we were relatively traumatized. Our waitress, Jasmine (?), was very nice about it, and told us her manager was going to come over to talk to us.   After about 15 minutes of paranoia that another spider would again drop on us, the manager came over and asked in a relatively sarcastic way for us to explain what happened. We told her what happened, and she kept insisting that she had never seen a spider in the building - implying that because she had never seen one, we must have brought it ourselves. She then asked us if we had been in any "dense forests" that day. She was very rude given the circumstances and highly implied that we had brought in this spider as some sort of scheme.   Although our waitress was very nice and the restaurant ended up giving us a free dessert, the behavior of the manager was completely offensive. Seriously, spiders are icky, so WHY WOULD WE BRING IN A GIANT SPIDER TO THE RESTAURANT?    Other than the incident, the food was alright.    TL;DR The manager was rude to us, and as a result, I don't plan on returning to this restaurant ever.
We've been here almost on a weekly basis. Food is good and environment is great for kids. Service is good too. The kids meal options are great. The $.99 sundae is a great touch.

Service is ALWAYS bad. Doesn't matter who the waitress is. We originally thought because we always sat in the same section and got the same girl, but we had someone else today. Same BAD SERVICE.  Great food. Just speed it up a little, people!  First of all, people who sit down a while after you should not get their food first. Didn't see them much again after the food arrived. Also, shouldn't wait over 10 minutes for a box and an additional 20 for the check. It's not even busy in here.

We always get the same exact thing  The tequila hicken fettuccine and the grilled veggie salad with salmon.  It's always delicious consistently good service and there's parking under ground, which is validated in the restaurant. It's a nice location too

We have frequented this CPK many times over the years and have always had a great experience. We have done fine in, take out, and recently had a catering order delivered. The service was impeccable, timely, and the food was consistently great. Thank you!

I visited the Pasadena CPK last Thursday. I've gone there many, many times because I attend All Saints church right next door after church often, like many of us do. I have always had amazing service and have gotten to know many of the waitstaff well. I had wanted to leave great feedback for our server on the CPK website, and even spoke to the manager, but my receipt didn't have the code on it. I encourage everybody who has great service there to leave feedback, it really makes a difference! My server was Eric M, and he was really helpful in meeting my dietary restrictions. I ordered the half roasted veggie salad with grilled shrimp and oil and balsamic on the side. I was happily accommodated. The reason for only four stars is the amount of veggies in it. Very little avocado, I was tempted to ask for more, and skimpy on the other veggies as well. But yummy shrimp! The salmon is great too but out of my price range. I applaud them that their mango ice tea is yummy and has no sugar in it, but my total for lunch was $23. A little out of my budget now. I sure wish that they still had their grilled veggies because they were wonderful!

Went in for the Pizza with a purpose to help support LA County Fire Dept., where CPK donates 20% of their food and beverage sales from 7/17 through 7/19.  No one including the manager knows that there was such a thing going on.  It wasn't that busy, being a Monday night, service was really slow, food was not as good as it used to be.  Drinks were terribly made and the place was filthy.  We were frequent customers of Pasadena CPK, but, don't think we'll be back ever!!

Luckily they have really good free bread here and I filled up on half a baguette, because the food was otherwise subpar.  I usually get the California Veggie pizza with no cheese. In the past, I've been told many times that this was vegan. Only recently, I saw an old Yelp review that said that the pizza crust at California Pizza Kitchen has eggs. Unfortunately, it's true. I confirmed it with the waitress. Seriously disappointed that I've been eating eggs this whole time, and none of the employees here were knowledgeable enough to tell me. What if this was a serious allergy? They really need to know their ingredients better.  I had to settle for the Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley soup and Super Spinach + Quinoa salad, which are both vegan. But be careful if you're allergic to dairy (or the ingredients in any of their other soups), because they warned me that all the soups are close together and can splash into one another. The price was pretty reasonable since it was from their lunch menu ($8.95 for a soup and salad lunch duo, valid Monday - Friday from 11 am - 4 pm). I was really hoping for something more substantial... The salad was very bland, and some pieces of the greens were just so bitter that I had to spit them out. The soup was just okay.  My boyfriend got the Shrimp Zucchini Scampi, which was also not great. It was mostly zucchini, with not much pasta or shrimp. And for a price of $15.99, the portion was just too small. My boyfriend eats an average amount, and he was still so hungry afterwards. He literally had to scavenge for the last bits of shrimp meat in the tails. And he even ate some of my leftover salad, which is saying a lot because he hates salad haha.  The added star is from the great service. Our waitress was so patient with my many questions and made sure to double check all the ingredients in their dishes. The validated parking was also convenient, since street parking is hard to find in this area.

We ordered a Business lunch for delivery from this location and they were on time and bought the food all packaged in boxes. Everything was great and organized, the deliverer was nice and there were names on the boxes to differentiate the difference. I have not eaten at this location yet but so far, the delivery service is amazing!

The last 2 times I have had dinner their, I was so dissatisfied. My son and I have enjoyed CPK for a very long time but, the last 2 times has made me feel i won't eat their again. The first time my family got all our dinners but my little niece's meal didn't come with ours. We waited al long time before it did. All of our dinners were cold. I had to go and asked where it was. The check was wrong and had to be corrected. Tonight we went again and waited a while to get out check after asking. The server passed us going outside and said he would be back. Got the wrong check and then given the correct check. I don't know why the service isn't like  it used to be.

2 visits: one good and one bad (July/Aug 2017) Even the good visit started badly, with two rude little hostess chicks pretending they couldn't understand carefully enunciated English. Guess the speaker was too "proper" and not trashy-slang speaking enough for them. Once the manager took over and got us seated, dinner was fine. The bad visit never really happened. With a call-ahead (calling one hour in advance to get on the list is their version of a reservation), I still couldn't get seated. The host and hostess were bumbling and rude, respectively. I just walked. Don't waste your time calling ahead; it's a front. CPK corporate, if you're reading this, you have a serious problem with your host station in Pasadena. You have WAY too much competition in this city for your "hosts" to run business out of the door. And, make no mistake, that's exactly what these amateurs are doing.

First time here at this location looks really cute. Excellent customer service especially the manager I regret I did not get her name. But my son with special needs ordered him self. The waiter brought what he had ordered but I guess in his mind it looked different...... right away the manager new he was not happy and asked what was the matter. My son described as best as he could the situation. She right way placed another other if pasta for him.  As soon as it came still my son was not content. I said it was ok. He would eat it after all the trouble I thought.... well the manager still was not happy she placed another order leaving the wrong one behind so my son could eat something while we where all eating. I was just amazed with the customer service.  I wished I lived close by to always come here!!! Thank u also much for everything.

This particular location never fails with their excellent customer service. I make the extra drive from Arcadia just to eat at this CPK. The servers at this location always have a smile, serve the food right away and don't forget about you. Will always come back !

Let me start this by saying, I LOVE LOVE LOVE their chicken piccata. OMG! It's heaven on a plate. While on disability in August 2016, I ordered this through  . YESSSSSSSSSSSS!!! I think I posted it to Instagram about 4 different times in a two month period.  Fast forward to August 2017. While on staycation, a friend invited me to lunch so we could catch up. I chose CPK since I hadn't been inside the restaurant in a few years. We were greeted well and seated quick. Our waitress Kitty was such a sweetie. My friend brought her nine-year-old daughter and Kitty treated this child as if she knew her. It was too cute to watch their interaction.  My friend and her daughter both ordered pizza and salad. I went straight for my chicken piccata. OMG, it was just as good as when I have it delivered because I do still order it at least once a month. YESSS!! My friend couldn't finish her pizza due to the wonderful bread CPK gives every table. It filled her up quicker than expected. My friend's daughter, well Kitty brought her, her own bread basket and she ate it all by herself. She's a big bread-eater for some odd reason, lol.  When ordering the chicken piccata, I suggest extra cream sauce. There's a charge but it's worth it. The chicken piccata comes with three pieces of breast meat and sometimes the chicken can be a little dry, so the extra cream sauce helps. In this case, during this visit, such was NOT the case. The three pieces were moist and the extra cream sauce was perfect for the pasta. I like a wet pasta and the sauce has lemon in it. SCORE! Because I was on staycation, I ordered an alcoholic beverage. WOO HOO! I'm a Beyonce fan so to see a drink on the menu called "Beehive," well, of COURSE, I had to try it. It's a sangria of sorts and while I like some sangrias, I'm more of a Moscato type of wine drinker. The beehive reminded me of a red wine so boohoo. The strawberries inside, once infused, were great! I should have stuck with their traditional sangria.  All in all, good visit. It was a little warm inside the restaurant but that could have been due to the alcohol. It does raise the blood pressure lol.

I absolutely loved this place. Amazing service, great food, and possibly the best lemonade I've ever had. The place has a bar for alcohol drinks. The out door seating is beautifully laid out. And it is just beautifully decorated inside. I'd highly recommend this place to all my friends and anyone looking for good Italian food. Besides the food and service, the place is outstanding gorgeous. There is also plenty of parking underneath. I would always come here because it's just so good. Booth seating in the back has a view to the side walk, street, and sky. The beautifully made menu makes it so easy to find what I want to have. I ordered pasta with shrimp and the shrimp was seasons PERFECTLY. I absolutely loved it.

I took my mother and two toddlers to this location and we had a waitress named Jack who was amazing. Not only was the service wonderful but she literally ran after us as we left to make sure we didn't leave behind my sons favorite toy car. Good food, but even better service.

The food was good and the outdoor setting is beautiful but during my visit the hostess' and cashier girls were very rude. Once I walked in nobody greeted me even though there was two employees at the hostess station by he door. I had to ask them where I would be able to order, they just pointed, no hellos or how are yous. There wasn't many people so I don't understand why. They sure did stare at me though, it was uncomfortable. They have these girls working there with no manners. While ordering I asked the young woman working the register a question about the food portions and she rolled her eyes and proceeded to tell me that she didn't know the answer. I definitely won't be going back. Maybe they'll hire more mature staff in the future and make customers experiences better than mine.

So they have Remolded this location and given it a more extensive and open feel.   The wait staff are extremely friendly and the food has always been fresh and well prepared.  Not a fans of the Fresca flavored drinks but the Pasta dishes as well as the salmon were good.  In Pasadena a very nice alternative to The Cheesecake Factory. If you are deciding between the two choose CPK by a mile

CPK serves good food specially crispy thin crust pizza. We ordered Bolognese spaghetti and Banh Mi Bowl tonight. The meat sauce in the Bolognese spaghetti is not salty and that makes it more healthy. The nutritious Banh Mi Bowl is one of the new CPK power bowls that have good portion of fresh avocados, cucumbers, carrots, sesame seeds, and grilled chicken. The chili-lime vinaigrette and serrano peppers make the bowl mouth watering. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our dinner.

I am a fan of CPK but I would recommend the Studio City location or the Glendale location over the Pasadena location. I ordered Chicken Fettuccine. The chicken in the dish was chopped up in tiny pieces almost like carnitas and there wasn't much of it. Everything else was fine about the dish. The issue was with the service. I sat outside in the lovely patio on 9/24 and had to ask several times for water and the bread that was offered to me. It wasn't packed with people because I went off hour so I'm not sure what the issue was. The server would walk right past me to take drink orders and food orders from other tables after he said he would be right back with water and/or bread for me. He was very friendly though.

09/26/2017 UPDATE REVIEW:                                               What's wrong with your hosts?? No matter how good is your food, the first person to welcome you in the restaurant is the key to give your customers a good or bad impression. I went there on Tuesday night with a group of friends. Because i was the first one to arrive I requested a table for 6. The 2 hosts instead of welcoming to the restaurant WHICH IS A NORMAL THING YOU EXPECT FROM THE HOSTS they asked me to wait for them to finish their conversation. Are you kidding me???? I waited 5 minutes until they finally decided to give me a table. Maybe they don't need our business?? although the place was pretty empty. CPK should hire better workers otherwise they're going to lose business especially when there's a lot of places to go.                                        Then we had to look for our waitress to take our order, after 20 minutes since we sat down. Yeah, pathetic. PREVIOUS REVIEW: We were called the "old peeps" lol. And it's true since our last visit was 2 years ago. The menu has definitely have changed-for better. There are more food selection for those who are not that crazy about their pizza. Our waitress, Milo, was so nice. The GM came over to our table and introduced himself after placing on our table a cheesy flat bread as a complementary to our dinner which i think that was pretty cool-unexpected. Then he told us about all the latest changes in the menu like no more tiramisu :( etc. I don't know about you but that personal attention is always nice and really appreciated which makes me feel like coming back more frequently......also, the drink menu is also new. They added more cocktails and other refreshing drinks. The restaurant was cleaned. We got our ticket validated as soon as we stepped inside the restaurant. The food was good. The dessert was yummy too. It was a nice experience.....glad we went back!!!

The food at all CPKs are about the same but what sets this CPK apart from the others is the location. This CPK is in a nice location and has outdoor seating. We parked in the street which is free after 5PM. They do a 90 minute parking validation as well but we couldn't really find where the parking lot was. With the location, you can take a stroll right in the heart of Pasadena. City hall is nearby and it looks great at night. Perfect for a stroll after dinner!

I have a love/hate relationship with this place. The menu good and is constantly evolving. They've added several pastas, a steak, and a Banh Mi bowl, and still have the classics like the avocado egg rolls and BBQ chicken pizza. However, the service is spotty. Everything from seating, to ordering, getting food, getting service, getting the check, and validating parking takes a long time. Set aside at least 1.5 hours to eat here.

Came by here while staying next door at the Westin. Came by a lil less than hour before they closed. It was pretty quiet, maybe 2-3 tables had customers. Upon entering nobody really acknowledged us. They kept going about their business and then came to the door after. Kinda weird feeling. However, once we were seated we were greeted by our server (forgot her name). She was really nice and super helpful in helping us choose some options for meals. I ordered the mac and cheese and a side salad and my bf a cobb salad with chicken. Our food came by pretty fast. I was very underwhelmed with the salad. It lacked flavor and freshness. I can barely finish it. My mac and cheese was good until I noticed a whole bunch of black stringy things which at first looked like hairs in it. However, upon reporting it to our waitress she said the cooks told her it was residue from a sponge ....weird... but anyways she took it back and didnt charge us but at this point I couldnt even eat anything anymore. Kind of put a damper on my experience. However, my bf enjoyed his salad and I really did like the Cucumber Lime Cooler I had. So theres that lol
Great place to bring the kids and the food is great too. Don't remember which pizza I had exactly but the thin crust pizza was amazing

We used to come to this CPK, maybe once every 2 weeks. It was consistently good. My wife ordered the Salmon Plank. It was always equally good as the previous time. Unfortunately, the last two times we were there, we were quite disappointed. The pasta was not done the last time either. I'm guessing there has been a change in management as well.  Need to get Robert back.
Server was beyond excellent...  Food was good...  Late night snack was enjoyed with "better half"...

Love, love, love their Chicken Piccatta. It's my husband's favorite also. We like their outside patio seating. It's nice on a sunny hot day. Service is great and management is super nice. Great place to have lunch.
Can't really complain. We each ordered a pizza and shared. We had the Thai Chicken, Garlic Pizza and BBQ. Nothing fancy, but good. Nice location.
This is one of my favorite CPK's in the area. They are very professional here in terms of service and food. They are also very clean. Good job!
my friend and i had a great time food was good she enjoyed her drink and best of all she had a smile on her face the bbq pizza was delicious and hers was also good

I don't even know where to begin with this meal.  We ordered dinner from here and this is what we ordered: 1. Kid's Mac and Cheese 2. BBQ Chicken Pizza on Crispy Thin Crust ($1.50 more for that) 3. Hawaiian Pizza on Crispy Thin Crust ($1.50 more for that) 4. Chicken Dumplings There was not a single thing here that we could eat.  The Mac and Cheese did not have ANY cheese sauce on it.  It was plain pasta with a tiny bit of broken sauce.  Both pizzas had SOGGY crust that was flimsy and not the slightest bit crispy at all. And don't forget that the pineapple on the Hawaiian pizza was not even cooked! The chicken dumplings were ICE COLD in the center like they had just been taken out of the refrigerator.  I understand that this is a chain restaurant and my expectations should not be that high but this is absurd and just completely unacceptable.

Started out great with a friendly server and got our order in pretty quick. The food was delicious and my drink was really yummy but we ended up being a forgotten table. Our server turned into the bartender.
The food was pretty good and my drink was really tasty but we ended up being a forgotten table. The outside seating is very nice.

I've been to a few other California Pizza Kitchens before. I've never ordered anything other than pizza. This afternoon I decided to try their Kung Pao Spaghetti which was alright. I guess this is not a direct reflection of this specific CPK but their Kung Pao Spaghetti is definitely not worth the $17.51 that was paid. I would've been more satisfied going to Panda Express and getting a plate for under $8.
